Legal_Issue: Whether statements made during patent prosecution can be used to establish estoppel against a patentee
Procedural_Stage: Appeal from initial refusal; consideration of amended defense
Evidence_Assessment: File wrapper (prosecution history) evidence was considered but rejected for establishing estoppel
Decision_Outcome: Paragraphs in the defendants' statement of defense alleging estoppel were struck out
Legal_Rule: The scope of a patent is determined solely by its issued claims; file wrapper evidence cannot alter claim scope or create estoppel
Procedural_Issue: Admissibility of file wrapper evidence to support an estoppel argument
Grounds_for_Claim: Defendants alleged equitable estoppel based on plaintiffs’ statements during prosecution
Outcome_on_Merits: Estoppel argument dismissed; claim scope governed by issued patent language
Key_Evidence_Considered: Statements made during patent prosecution (file wrapper)
Legal_Framework: Canadian Patent Act and common law principles of claim construction
Applicant_Challenge: Plaintiffs sought to strike out allegations of estoppel in the defense
Legal_Rule_Source: Canadian case law and statutory interpretation of patent claims
Defendant_Response: Asserted estoppel based on plaintiff’s prosecution conduct
Remedy_Requested: Striking out of paragraphs in the statement of defense
Legal_Provision_Cited: Relevant sections of the Patent Act regarding claim interpretation
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: File wrapper evidence not admissible to establish estoppel in Canadian law
Applicable_Process: Pleading review and motion to strike
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Motion to strike portions of the defense
Governing_Rule: Claims define patent scope; prosecution history inadmissible for estoppel
